Apollo Hospital â€“ Short Details

Apollo Hospitals is one of the leading private healthcare chains in South Asia, originally founded in 1983 in Chennai, India. It has grown into a large network with hospitals, clinics, pharmacies, and diagnostic centers across India and in some international locations.

Key Highlights
	â€¢	Founded: 1983 by Dr. Prathap C. Reddy.
	â€¢	Headquarters: Chennai, India.
	â€¢	Specialties: Cardiology, Oncology, Neurology, Orthopedics, Organ Transplants, Gastroenterology, Critical Care, and more.
	â€¢	Facilities: Advanced diagnostics, robotic surgery, telemedicine, and preventive health programs.
	â€¢	Accreditations: Many Apollo hospitals are accredited by NABH (India) and JCI (International).
	â€¢	Presence in Bangladesh: Apollo Hospitals Dhaka (now renamed Evercare Hospital Dhaka) was one of the most advanced tertiary care hospitals in Bangladesh.

Services
	â€¢	24/7 Emergency & Trauma care.
	â€¢	International patient services.
	â€¢	Multi-specialty consultations.
	â€¢	Modern diagnostic and imaging facilities.
	â€¢	Comprehensive health check-up packages.
